itemDescription: Irish suffragist and active participant of the co-operative movement

wikipedia_page.main: Margaret McCoubrey (1880–1955) was an Irish suffragist and active participant of the co-operative movement.

response: *Margaret McCoubrey (1880–1955) – Irish suffragist and active participant of the co-operative movement.

The party won 12 seats on Belfast Corporation in 1920, but later lost these. Suffragette, Independent Labour and Co-operative activist Margaret McCoubrey in 1920 was elected a Labour councillor for the Dock ward of Belfast.McCoubrey, Margaret 1880-1955 Dictionary of Ulster Biography   Nonetheless, the party came a very close second in Belfast West in the 1923 UK general election before forming with others the Northern Ireland Labour Party.
*Margaret McCoubrey (1880–1955) – Scottish-born Irish suffragist, co-operative movement activist

The suffragette and co-operative activist Margaret McCoubrey, a Labour councillor for Dock ward in Belfast, taught in the Skerry's Business Training College, Glasgow, where she became deputy head mistress at the age of twenty-four.
*11 April – Margaret McCoubrey, suffragette and pacifist (born 1880 in Scotland).
* Margaret McCoubrey, suffragette and pacifist in Belfast (died 1955 in Northern Ireland)
Margaret McCoubrey (1880–1955) joined the society in 1910 and became an active militant.
